trans-unit.source: Create a new Azure Service Principal using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Create a new Azure Service Principal using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Describes how to create a new Azure service principal that can be used with the role-based access control in Azure Resource Manager to manage access to resources.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to create a new Azure service principal that can be used with the role-based access control in Azure Resource Manager to manage access to resources.

trans-unit.source: A service principal is an automated processes, application or service that needs to access other resources.
trans-unit.target: A service principal is an automated processes, application or service that needs to access other resources.

trans-unit.source: Using Azure Resource Manager, you can grant access to a service principal and authenticate it so it can perform the permitted management actions on resources that exist in the subscription or as a tenant.
trans-unit.target: Using Azure Resource Manager, you can grant access to a service principal and authenticate it so it can perform the permitted management actions on resources that exist in the subscription or as a tenant.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to create a new service principal using the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to create a new service principal using the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Currently, you must use the Microsoft Azure portal to create a new service principal.
trans-unit.target: Currently, you must use the Microsoft Azure portal to create a new service principal.

trans-unit.source: This ability will be added to the Azure preview portal in a later release.
trans-unit.target: This ability will be added to the Azure preview portal in a later release.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory (AAD) - an identity and access management service build for the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory (AAD) - an identity and access management service build for the cloud.

trans-unit.source: For more details see: <linkText>What is Azure active Directory</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details see: <linkText>What is Azure active Directory</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Service Principal - an instance of an application in a directory.
trans-unit.target: Service Principal - an instance of an application in a directory.

trans-unit.source: AD Application - a directory record in AAD that identifies an application to AAD.
trans-unit.target: AD Application - a directory record in AAD that identifies an application to AAD.

trans-unit.source: For more details see <linkText>Basics of Authentication in Azure AD</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details see <linkText>Basics of Authentication in Azure AD</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Login to your Azure Account through the <linkText>classic portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Login to your Azure Account through the <linkText>classic portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Select Active Directory from the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Select Active Directory from the left pane.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>select Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>select Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the directory that you want to use for creating the new application.
trans-unit.target: Select the directory that you want to use for creating the new application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>choose directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>choose directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To view the applications in your directory, click on Applications.
trans-unit.target: To view the applications in your directory, click on Applications.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>view applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>view applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you haven't created an application in that directory before you should see something similar to following image.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't created an application in that directory before you should see something similar to following image.

trans-unit.source: Click on ADD AN APPLICATION
trans-unit.target: Click on ADD AN APPLICATION

trans-unit.source: <linkText>add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Or, click Add in the bottom pane.
trans-unit.target: Or, click Add in the bottom pane.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>add</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>add</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the type of application you would like to create.
trans-unit.target: Select the type of application you would like to create.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, we will not use an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, we will not use an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>new application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>new application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Fill in name of the application and select the type of application you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Fill in name of the application and select the type of application you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Since we intend to use this application's service principal to authenticate with Azure Resource Manager, we will elect to create a WEB APPLICATION AND/OR WEB API and click the next button.
trans-unit.target: Since we intend to use this application's service principal to authenticate with Azure Resource Manager, we will elect to create a WEB APPLICATION AND/OR WEB API and click the next button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>name application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>name application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Fill in the properties for your app.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the properties for your app.

trans-unit.source: For SIGN-ON URL, provide the URI to a web-site that describes your application.
trans-unit.target: For SIGN-ON URL, provide the URI to a web-site that describes your application.

trans-unit.source: The existence of the web-site is not validated.
trans-unit.target: The existence of the web-site is not validated.

trans-unit.source: For APP ID URI, provide the URI that identifies your application.
trans-unit.target: For APP ID URI, provide the URI that identifies your application.

trans-unit.source: The uniqueness or existence of the endpoint is not validated.
trans-unit.target: The uniqueness or existence of the endpoint is not validated.

trans-unit.source: Click the Complete to create you AAD Application.
trans-unit.target: Click the Complete to create you AAD Application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>application properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>application properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The portal should now have your application selected.
trans-unit.target: The portal should now have your application selected.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Configure tab to configure your application's password.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Configure tab to configure your application's password.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>configure application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>configure application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the Keys section and select how long you would like your password to be valid.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the Keys section and select how long you would like your password to be valid.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>keys</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>keys</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Save to create your key.
trans-unit.target: Select Save to create your key.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>save</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>save</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The saved key is displayed and you can copy it.
trans-unit.target: The saved key is displayed and you can copy it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>saved key</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>saved key</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can now use you key to authenticate as a service principal.
trans-unit.target: You can now use you key to authenticate as a service principal.

trans-unit.source: You will need your CLIENT ID in addition to your KEY to sign in.
trans-unit.target: You will need your CLIENT ID in addition to your KEY to sign in.

trans-unit.source: Go to CLIENT ID and copy it.
trans-unit.target: Go to CLIENT ID and copy it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>client id</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>client id</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Your application is now ready and the service principal created on your tenant.
trans-unit.target: Your application is now ready and the service principal created on your tenant.

trans-unit.source: When signing in as a service principal be sure to use:
trans-unit.target: When signing in as a service principal be sure to use:

trans-unit.source: CLIENT ID - as your user name.
trans-unit.target: CLIENT ID - as your user name.

trans-unit.source: KEY - as your password.
trans-unit.target: KEY - as your password.

trans-unit.source: To learn about specifying security policies, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: To learn about specifying security policies, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For the steps to permit a service principal to access resources, see <linkText>Authenticating a Service Principal with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For the steps to permit a service principal to access resources, see <linkText>Authenticating a Service Principal with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For an overview of role-based access control, see <linkText>Role-based access control in the Microsoft Azure portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For an overview of role-based access control, see <linkText>Role-based access control in the Microsoft Azure portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For guidance on implementing security with Azure Resource Manager, see <linkText>Security considerations for Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For guidance on implementing security with Azure Resource Manager, see <linkText>Security considerations for Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>
